exercises.instruction: Rewrite phrases using ’s or of, as requested.

items.prompt: Rewrite using ’s: the bike belonging to Anna.
Rewrite using ’s: the passport belonging to Ben.
Rewrite using ’s: the phone belonging to Chris.
Rewrite using ’s: the bag belonging to Dina.
Rewrite using ’s: the jacket belonging to Ethan.
Rewrite using ’s: the camera belonging to Fatima.
Rewrite using ’s: the car belonging to George.
Rewrite using ’s: the umbrella belonging to Hana.
Rewrite using ’s: the keys belonging to Ivan.
Rewrite using ’s: the laptop belonging to Julia.
Rewrite using ’s: the tail belonging to the dog.
Rewrite using ’s: the paw belonging to the cat.
Rewrite using ’s: the website belonging to the company.
Rewrite using ’s: the window belonging to the bakery.
Rewrite using ’s: the entrance belonging to the museum.
Rewrite using of: the roof belonging to the house.
Rewrite using of: the end belonging to the street.
Rewrite using of: the name belonging to the book.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using plural or irregular plural possessives.

items.prompt: Rewrite with a plural possessive: the car belonging to my parents.
Rewrite with a plural possessive: the office used by the managers.
Rewrite with a plural possessive: the room for the students.
Rewrite with an irregular plural: the toys belonging to the children.
Rewrite with an irregular plural: the books for the men.
Rewrite with a plural possessive: the bikes belonging to my friends.
Rewrite with a plural possessive: the meeting for the teachers.
Rewrite with an irregular plural: the clothes for the women.
Rewrite with a plural possessive: the flat belonging to my neighbours.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using ’s with time/amount expressions.

items.prompt: Rewrite using ’s for time: a holiday that lasts a week.
Rewrite using ’s for time: work that takes two hours.
Rewrite using ’s for time: a walk that takes ten minutes.
Rewrite using ’s for time: a course that lasts three months.
Rewrite using ’s for time: a delay of five minutes.

exercises.instruction: Choose the phrase that sounds more natural.

items.prompt: Choose the more natural phrase (write one): the bakery's window / the window of the bakery.
Choose the more natural phrase (write one): the door of the garage / the garage's door.
Choose the more natural phrase (write one): the museum's entrance / the entrance of the museum.
Choose the more natural phrase (write one): the leg of the table / the table's leg.

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct reflexive pronoun.

items.prompt: Complete: I introduced ____ to the group.
Complete: I blamed ____ for the delay.
Complete: I hurt ____ on the broken glass.
Complete: I enjoyed ____ at the concert.
Complete: I burnt ____ on the kettle.
Complete: I taught ____ to play chess.
Complete: I controlled ____ during the argument.

exercises.instruction: Complete with natural forms like get dressed, shave, wash, etc.

items.prompt: Complete: He ____ quickly because he was late.
Complete: I ____ before breakfast most days.
Complete: She ____ and went out.
Complete: The kids ____ and ran outside.
Complete: After the swim, we ____ and had lunch.
Complete: He ____ and put on a clean shirt.
Complete: I need to ____ first. Then I can call you.
Complete: She ____ and did her hair.
Complete: They ____ and left the hotel.

exercises.instruction: Complete with each other / one another.

items.prompt: Complete: They helped ____ during the move.
Complete: They don't understand ____ sometimes.
Complete: They see ____ every weekend.
Complete: They text ____ every day.
Complete: They avoid ____ at work.
Complete: They blamed ____ after the match.
Complete: They looked at ____ and smiled.
Complete: They trust ____ completely.

exercises.instruction: Complete sentences using -self/-selves for emphasis.

items.prompt: Complete with emphasis: I fixed the shelf ____.
Complete with emphasis: She baked the bread ____.
Complete with emphasis: We organised the trip ____.
Complete: The manager ____ approved the plan.
Complete: The actress ____ answered the question.
Complete: The owner ____ welcomed us at the door.
Complete with emphasis: They built the table ____.
Complete: The doctor ____ called me back.
Complete: I ____ didn’t expect it to be so hard.

exercises.instruction: Answer using -self/-selves to show 'without help' or emphasis.

items.prompt: Complete: 'Who painted the room?' — 'Nobody. I painted it ____.'
Complete: 'Who cut your hair?' — 'Nobody. I cut it ____.'
Complete: 'Did anyone tell you?' — 'No, she told me ____.'
Complete: 'Who will carry the boxes?' — 'We’ll carry them ____.'
Complete: 'Who repaired the bike?' — 'He repaired it ____.'
Complete: 'Did they organise it?' — 'Yes, they organised it ____.'

exercises.instruction: Rewrite phrases using 'a ... of mine/yours/his' etc.

items.prompt: Rewrite using 'of mine': one of my friends.
Rewrite using 'of mine': one of my colleagues.
Rewrite using 'of mine': one of my neighbours.
Rewrite using 'of mine': one of my students.
Rewrite using 'of mine': one of my customers.
Rewrite using 'of mine': one of my cousins.
Rewrite using 'of mine': one of my teachers.
Rewrite using 'of mine': one of my partners.

exercises.instruction: Complete with mine/yours/his/hers/ours/theirs.

items.prompt: Complete: She’s a close friend of ____ (I).
Complete: That cousin of ____ (you) lives in Paris.
Complete: A colleague of ____ (we) recommended this café.
Complete: One student of ____ (they) won a prize.
Complete: An idea of ____ (he) solved the problem.

exercises.instruction: Complete using 'own' where it fits.

items.prompt: Complete: I want my ____ desk, not a shared one.
Complete: They bought their ____ house last year.
Complete: She runs her ____ business now.
Complete: Do you have your ____ room?
Complete: He brought his ____ tools.

exercises.instruction: Complete with on my own / by myself (alone).

items.prompt: Complete: I went to the concert ____.
Complete: She lives ____ now.
Complete: He ate at a restaurant ____.
Complete: We stayed at home ____.
Complete: They travelled ____.

exercises.instruction: Complete with on my own / by myself to match the meaning.

items.prompt: Complete (meaning: without help): She fixed the sink ____.
Complete (meaning: without help): I learnt to cook ____.
Complete (meaning: without help): They built the shelf ____.
Complete (meaning: without help): We organised the event ____.
Complete (meaning: alone): Don’t walk home ____ at night.
Complete (meaning: alone): He was sitting ____.
Complete (meaning: alone): I don’t like eating ____.
Complete (meaning: without help): Ben repaired the bike ____.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite each sentence using on my own / by myself.

items.prompt: Rewrite: I did it without anyone’s help.
items.canonical: I did it on my own.
accepted_variants: I did it on my own
I did it on my own.
i did it on my own.

items.prompt: Rewrite: She went there alone.
Rewrite: They solved it without help.
items.canonical: They solved it on their own.
accepted_variants: They solved it on their own
They solved it on their own.
they solved it on their own.

items.prompt: Rewrite: He lives alone.
Rewrite: We travelled alone.
Rewrite: I taught myself the basics.
items.canonical: I learnt the basics on my own.
accepted_variants: I learnt the basics on my own
I learnt the basics on my own.
i learnt the basics on my own.

items.prompt: Rewrite: She stayed alone in the flat.
items.canonical: She stayed in the flat by herself.
accepted_variants: She stayed in the flat by herself
She stayed in the flat by herself.
she stayed in the flat by herself.

exercises.instruction: Complete sentences with there is/are or Is/Are there.

items.prompt: Complete: ____ a mistake on the table.

Complete: ____ person needs sleep.

exercises.instruction: Complete with everybody/everyone/everything or all (of).

items.prompt: Complete: ____ knows the answer in this class.
Complete: ____ is ready. Let's start.
Complete: ____ was talking at once.
Complete: ____ of us agreed to leave early.
Complete: I told ____ I knew.
Complete: ____ of them left before the end.
Complete: ____ was closed on Sunday.
Complete: ____ needs a break sometimes.
Complete: ____ of the team was tired.

exercises.instruction: Choose between all day / the whole day, and use whole where needed.

items.prompt: Choose the better phrase (write it): I worked all day / I worked the whole day.
Choose the better phrase (write it): I stayed at home the whole day / I stayed at home all day.
items.canonical: I stayed at home all day
accepted_variants: I stayed at home all day
i stayed at home all day
I stayed at home all day
I stayed at home all day
I stayed at home all day!
I stayed at home all day.
I stayed at home all day?
i stayed at home all day!
i stayed at home all day.
i stayed at home all day?

items.prompt: Complete: We waited ____ hour.
Complete: She slept ____ night.
Complete: He studied ____ afternoon.

exercises.instruction: Mixed practice with all, every, whole, and of-phrases.

items.prompt: Complete: I was on the phone ____ morning.
Complete: We drove ____ night.
Complete: ____ of the cake is gone.
Complete: ____ of the village was without power.
Rewrite using whole: I spent all the afternoon cleaning.
items.canonical: I spent the whole afternoon cleaning.
accepted_variants: I spent the whole afternoon cleaning
I spent the whole afternoon cleaning.
i spent the whole afternoon cleaning.

items.prompt: Complete: She watched TV ____ evening.
